Pre-Game Insights: The game is scheduled for Saturday, 01:30 AM BST.
Cleveland Cavaliers to win with handicap (-4.5).
Jarret Allen over 25.5 total points + rebounds.
The Cavs remain the only undefeated team in the league after the Nuggets have beaten OKC Thunder a couple of nights ago.
GSW have also been great, losing just one game so far.
The Cavs have a much better starting lineup and that usually makes a difference, so with them also playing at home, the Cavs to win by five or more points is my first Cavs vs Warriors prediction.
Cleveland are at the top with 123.2 points per game, while the Warriors are averaging 121.1 points per game.
Jarret Allen has been in great form this season, averaging 15.1 points per game and 11.9 rebounds per game.
The Cavs are looking like a true championship contender early in the season.
Max Strus, Emoni Bates, and Dean Wade are on the team's injury list heading into this game.
The Cavs enter this match with a 9-0 record.
Cavaliers starting lineup: Garland, Mitchell, Okoro, Mobley, Allen.
Golden State might have to manage without Brandin Podziemski, De'Anthony Melton, and Draymond Green tonight, who are all listed as game-time decisions.
